div.p: On June 22, 2019, our second graduating class collected diplomas and stepped out into the world to do good work.

p.span: Vertus High School is a free public high school for young men. We provide unprecedented individual support and consistent high expectations for academic success and character growth. Since we opened in 2014, our students have exceeded national expectations for student growth and performance. Look at our results or watch this video to learn more.

h3.span: Why choose Vertus for your young man?

div.p: Each student is part of a small learning team of 16-18 students led by a full-time mentor and guide called a preceptor. Preceptors have our students' backs 24/7/365. They create a safe and supportive environment in which each young man has an adult who is responsible for his success.

We combine high-tech, online learning with traditional classroom experiences meeting each student where he is academically and supporting him to accelerate his growth. Our year round calendar provides more learning time so that students can meet all the requirements for graduation and prepare for college and careers.

Students explore our three virtues of courage, leadership, and responsibility in our daily character curriculum. Weekly awards recognize academic achievement and character growth. Sports, field trips, extracurricular activities, college courses, and work opportunities help students understand the world and grow as leaders.
Check out what 3rd-year student Tyrin Hill has to say about the brotherhood he’s found at Vertus and the benefits of being able to work at his own pace.
Vertus High School is a non-profit, public charter high school in Rochester, NY. We serve students grades 9-12, preparing leaders of character for the community and the workplace.
